land.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an area of ground, especially when used for farming or building
land.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: They own a lot of land.
He bought a piece of land.
land.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the solid dry part of the Earth’s surface
land.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: After 21 days at sea, we sighted land.
The white stork is one of the biggest land birds of the region.
Troops began an assault on the city by land and sea.
The crocodile lays its eggs on land.
land.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Their journey took them to many foreign lands.
Australia represented a real land of opportunity for thousands of people.
He’s fiercely proud of his native land.
land.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the area of land that someone owns
land.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: He ordered us to get off his land.
land.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: an acre/hectare of land
The family owned hundreds of acres of land.
a piece of land
He built a house on a piece of land near the river.
a plot/parcel of land
They farmed a small plot of land.
a strip of land
They owned the strip of land between the forest and the sea.
a tract of land
Cattle ranching requires large tracts of land.
fertile/rich
The land near the river is very fertile.
It is poor land that should never have been farmed.
vacant/derelict
The houses could be built on derelict land.
open land
In the middle of the city are several hundred acres of open land.
agricultural land
The factory is causing severe pollution to nearby agricultural land.
arable land
Some pastures were converted into arable land.
industrial land
The canal basin area is designated as industrial land.
housing/building land
The shortage of housing land is a problem in the south-east.
land.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: an area that is owned by someone or that can be used for farming or building houses
They moved to the country and bought some land.
land that is used for farming
The area is one of gently rolling hills and farmland.
land that belongs to a country or that is controlled by a country during a war
His plane was forced to make an emergency landing in Chinese territory.
The army was advancing into enemy territory.
the gardens and land around a big building such as a castle, school, or hospital
The grounds of the castle are open to visitors every weekend.
a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner
The film is set on an English country estate.
land.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if a plane, bird, or insect lands, it moves safely down onto the ground
land.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The bird landed gracefully on the water.
land.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to make a plane move safely down onto the ground at the end of a journey
land.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The pilot managed to land the aircraft safely.
land.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to arrive somewhere in a plane, boat etc
land.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: We expect to be landing in Oslo in about fifty minutes.
In 1969, the first men landed on the Moon.
land.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to come down through the air onto something
land.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: A large branch landed on the hood of my car.
Louis fell out of the tree and landed in a holly bush.
She fell and landed heavily on the floor.
A couple of bombs landed quite near to the village.
land.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: if a boat or aircraft lands people or goods, it brings them to a place, and the people get out or the goods are carried out
land.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: The troops were landed by helicopter.
land.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: to succeed in getting a job, contract etc that was difficult to get
land.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: He landed a job with a law firm.
Bill’s just landed himself a part in a Broadway show.
land.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: to arrive unexpectedly, and cause problems
land.translation[1].definitions[6].examp: Just when I thought my problems were over, this letter landed on my desk.
land.translation[1].note_box[0].items[0]: Land belongs to a group of verbs where the same noun can be the subject of the verb or its object
land.translation[1].note_box[0].items[1]: In this sentence, ‘the plane’ is the object of land
He landed the plane in a field
land.translation[1].note_box[0].items[2]: In this sentence, ‘the plane’ is the subject of land
The plane landed in a field
land.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: ground, especially ground used for building or farming on
land.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Land has always been a good investment.
land.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: ground in the country used for growing food, animals etc
land.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Many farmers have given up working the land because of low rates of return.
land.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: an area of land that a person or organization owns
land.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: He exploited the mineral resources which he found under his lands.
land.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: if a plane lands, or if a pilot lands it, it moves down on to the ground in a controlled way
land.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to put someone or something on land from an aircraft or boat
land.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: He landed his load of illegal immigrants on the Kent coast at midnight.
land.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: if you land a job or a contract, you manage to get it
land.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: It has just landed a big contract to install a defense communications system.
